interfaces.hil.enhanced_hilÂ¶

Source: src\interfaces\hil\enhanced_hil.py

Module OverviewÂ¶

Enhanced Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL) system for advanced control testing. This module provides a comprehensive HIL framework with real-time capabilities, fault injection, automated testing, and integration with hardware interfaces for professional control system validation.

Mathematical FoundationÂ¶

Enhanced HIL CapabilitiesÂ¶

Advanced HIL features beyond basic simulation:

\[\text{HIL}_{\text{enhanced}} = \text{HIL}_{\text{basic}} + \mathcal{F}_{\text{advanced}}\]

Where \(\mathcal{F}_{\text{advanced}}\) includes parameter variation, disturbance injection, and adaptive testing.

Parameter Variation StudiesÂ¶

Systematic Parameter Sweep:

\[\mathcal{P} = \{p_1, p_2, \ldots, p_n\} \times \{v_1, v_2, \ldots, v_m\}\]

Monte Carlo Sampling:

\[p_i \sim \mathcal{D}_i \quad \text{(Distribution for parameter } i\text{)}\]

Disturbance InjectionÂ¶

External Disturbances:

\[\dot{\vec{x}} = f(\vec{x}, u) + g(\vec{x}) \vec{w}(t)\]

Where:

  • \(g(\vec{x})\): Disturbance coupling matrix

  • \(\vec{w}(t)\): Disturbance signal

Common Disturbance Types:

  1. Step: \(w(t) = A \cdot \mathbb{1}(t \geq t_0)\)

  2. Ramp: \(w(t) = k \cdot t\)

  3. Sinusoidal: \(w(t) = A \sin(\omega t + \phi)\)

  4. Random: \(w(t) \sim \mathcal{N}(0, \sigma^2)\)

Adaptive TestingÂ¶

Difficulty Adaptation:

\[\begin{split}\text{Difficulty}(n+1) = \begin{cases} \text{Difficulty}(n) + \Delta & \text{if PASS} \\ \text{Difficulty}(n) - \Delta & \text{if FAIL} \end{cases}\end{split}\]

Exploration-Exploitation Tradeoff:

\[\begin{split}\text{Test}(n) = \begin{cases} \text{Random} & \text{with probability } \epsilon \\ \text{Hardest Failed} & \text{with probability } 1 - \epsilon \end{cases}\end{split}\]

Multi-Fidelity SimulationÂ¶

Fidelity Levels:

\[\mathcal{M} = \{M_{\text{low}}, M_{\text{medium}}, M_{\text{high}}\}\]

Cost-Accuracy Tradeoff:

\[\text{Total Cost} = \sum_{i} C_i \cdot N_i\]

Subject to accuracy constraint:

\[\|\text{Error}_{\text{total}}\| < \epsilon_{\text{target}}\]

Performance ProfilingÂ¶

Execution Time Distribution:

\[T_{\text{exec}} \sim \mathcal{D}_{\text{exec}}\]

Percentile Analysis:

  • P50 (median)

  • P95 (tail latency)

  • P99 (worst-case)

Hardware EmulationÂ¶

Virtual Hardware Models:

\[\text{Virtual Actuator}: u_{\text{actual}} = h(u_{\text{cmd}}, \vec{p}_{\text{hw}})\]

Where \(\vec{p}_{\text{hw}}\) includes hardware parameters (bandwidth, saturation, delay).

Sensor Emulation:

\[y = C\vec{x} + \vec{v}, \quad \vec{v} \sim \mathcal{N}(0, R)\]

Architecture DiagramÂ¶

graph TD A[Enhanced HIL] --> B[Parameter Variation] B --> C[Monte Carlo Sampling] B --> D[Grid Search] A --> E[Disturbance Injection] E --> F[Step Disturbance] E --> G[Sinusoidal Disturbance] E --> H[Random Disturbance] A --> I[Adaptive Testing] I --> J[Difficulty Adaptation] I --> K[Exploration/Exploitation] A --> L[Multi-Fidelity] L --> M[Low Fidelity Model] L --> N[Medium Fidelity Model] L --> O[High Fidelity Model] C --> P[Test Execution] D --> P F --> P G --> P H --> P J --> P K --> P M --> P N --> P O --> P P --> Q[Results Analysis] Q --> R[Performance Profiling] Q --> S[Robustness Assessment] style A fill:#9cf style P fill:#ff9 style Q fill:#f9f

Enhanced Features:

  1. Parameter Variation: Systematic exploration of parameter space

  2. Disturbance Injection: Test robustness under external disturbances

  3. Adaptive Testing: Dynamically adjust test difficulty

  4. Multi-Fidelity: Trade accuracy for speed using model hierarchy

Usage ExamplesÂ¶

Example 1: Parameter Variation StudyÂ¶

from src.interfaces.hil.enhanced_hil import ParameterSweep

# Parameter sweep
sweep = ParameterSweep()

# Define parameter ranges
sweep.add_parameter("mass_cart", values=np.linspace(0.8, 1.2, 5))
sweep.add_parameter("length_1", values=np.linspace(0.3, 0.5, 5))

# Run sweep
results = sweep.run()

# Analyze sensitivity
for param, result in results.items():
    print(f"{param}: sensitivity = {result.sensitivity:.4f}")

Example 2: Disturbance InjectionÂ¶

from src.interfaces.hil.enhanced_hil import DisturbanceInjector

# Create disturbance injector
injector = DisturbanceInjector()

# Add sinusoidal disturbance
injector.add_disturbance(
    type="sinusoidal",
    amplitude=5.0,
    frequency=1.0,
    start_time=2.0
)

# Simulate with disturbance
for t in np.arange(0, 10, 0.01):
    state = plant.get_state()
    control = controller.compute(state)

    # Add disturbance
    disturbed_control = injector.apply(control, t)

    plant.step(disturbed_control)

Example 3: Multi-Fidelity SimulationÂ¶

from src.interfaces.hil.enhanced_hil import MultiFidelitySimulator

# Multi-fidelity simulator
simulator = MultiFidelitySimulator()

# Define fidelity levels
simulator.add_model("low", SimplifiedDynamics())
simulator.add_model("medium", FullDynamics(accuracy="medium"))
simulator.add_model("high", FullDynamics(accuracy="high"))

# Run with adaptive fidelity
result = simulator.run_adaptive(
    initial_fidelity="low",
    accuracy_target=1e-3,
    max_cost=100.0
)

print(f"Final fidelity: {result.final_fidelity}")
print(f"Total cost: {result.total_cost:.1f}")
print(f"Accuracy achieved: {result.accuracy:.6f}")

Example 4: Hardware EmulationÂ¶

from src.interfaces.hil.enhanced_hil import HardwareEmulator

# Hardware emulator
emulator = HardwareEmulator()

# Configure actuator model
emulator.set_actuator_model(
    bandwidth=50.0,  # 50 Hz bandwidth
    saturation=100.0,
    delay=0.01  # 10 ms delay
)

# Configure sensor model
emulator.set_sensor_model(
    noise_std=0.01,
    bias=0.005,
    dropout_rate=0.01
)

# Simulate with hardware emulation
for t in np.arange(0, 10, 0.01):
    state = plant.get_state()

    # Emulate sensor
    measured_state = emulator.sensor(state)

    # Compute control
    control = controller.compute(measured_state)

    # Emulate actuator
    actual_control = emulator.actuator(control)

    plant.step(actual_control)

Example 5: Performance ProfilingÂ¶

from src.interfaces.hil.enhanced_hil import PerformanceProfiler

# Performance profiler
profiler = PerformanceProfiler()

# Profile simulation
profiler.start()

for t in np.arange(0, 10, 0.01):
    with profiler.section("dynamics"):
        state = plant.get_state()

    with profiler.section("control"):
        control = controller.compute(state)

    with profiler.section("communication"):
        client.send_control(control)

profiler.stop()

# Report profiling results
report = profiler.generate_report()
print(report.to_string())

# Identify bottlenecks
for section, time in report.sorted_sections():
    print(f"{section}: {time:.2f} ms ({report.percentage(section):.1f}%)")

Complete Source CodeÂ¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#========================= src/interfaces/hil/enhanced_hil.py =========================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Enhanced Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL) system for advanced control testing.
  7This module provides a comprehensive HIL framework with real-time capabilities,
  8fault injection, automated testing, and integration with hardware interfaces
  9for professional control system validation.
 10"""
 11
 12import asyncio
 13import time
 14import numpy as np
 15from dataclasses import dataclass, field
 16from typing import Dict, Any, Optional, List
 17from enum import Enum
 18import logging
 19
 20from ..core.protocols import CommunicationProtocol
 21from ..hardware.device_drivers import DeviceManager
 22from ..network.factory import NetworkInterfaceFactory
 23
 24
 25class HILMode(Enum):
 26    """HIL operation mode enumeration."""
 27    SIMULATION_ONLY = "simulation_only"
 28    HARDWARE_ONLY = "hardware_only"
 29    HYBRID = "hybrid"
 30    REAL_TIME = "real_time"
 31    NON_REAL_TIME = "non_real_time"
 32
 33
 34class HILState(Enum):
 35    """HIL system state enumeration."""
 36    IDLE = "idle"
 37    INITIALIZING = "initializing"
 38    READY = "ready"
 39    RUNNING = "running"
 40    PAUSED = "paused"
 41    ERROR = "error"
 42    SHUTDOWN = "shutdown"
 43
 44
 45@dataclass
 46class TimingConfig:
 47    """HIL timing configuration."""
 48    sample_time: float = 0.001  # 1ms default
 49    max_jitter: float = 0.0001  # 100Î¼s jitter tolerance
 50    deadline_factor: float = 0.9  # Use 90% of sample time as deadline
 51    priority: int = 99  # High priority for real-time
 52    cpu_affinity: Optional[List[int]] = None
 53
 54
 55@dataclass
 56class TestScenario:
 57    """HIL test scenario configuration."""
 58    name: str
 59    description: str
 60    duration: float
 61    initial_conditions: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
 62    parameters: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
 63    expected_results: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
 64    tolerance: Dict[str, float] = field(default_factory=dict)
 65    fault_scenarios: List[Dict[str, Any]] = field(default_factory=list)
 66
 67
 68@dataclass
 69class HILConfig:
 70    """Comprehensive HIL system configuration."""
 71    # System identification
 72    system_name: str = "HIL_System"
 73    system_id: str = "hil_001"
 74
 75    # Operation mode
 76    mode: HILMode = HILMode.HYBRID
 77    real_time: bool = True
 78
 79    # Timing configuration
 80    timing: TimingConfig = field(default_factory=TimingConfig)
 81
 82    # Communication settings
 83    controller_endpoint: str = "localhost:8080"
 84    plant_endpoint: str = "localhost:8081"
 85    protocol: str = "udp"
 86
 87    # Hardware configuration
 88    hardware_devices: List[Dict[str, Any]] = field(default_factory=list)
 89
 90    # Simulation settings
 91    simulation_model: Optional[str] = None
 92    simulation_params: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
 93
 94    # Safety and monitoring
 95    enable_safety_monitoring: bool = True
 96    enable_watchdog: bool = True
 97    watchdog_timeout: float = 1.0
 98    emergency_stop_channels: List[str] = field(default_factory=list)
 99
100    # Data logging
101    enable_logging: bool = True
102    log_level: str = "INFO"
103    data_buffer_size: int = 100000
104
105    # Test automation
106    enable_automated_testing: bool = False
107    test_scenarios: List[TestScenario] = field(default_factory=list)
108
109
110class EnhancedHILSystem:
111    """
112    Enhanced Hardware-in-the-Loop system with advanced capabilities.
113
114    This class provides a comprehensive HIL framework that integrates
115    simulation, hardware, real-time scheduling, fault injection,
116    and automated testing for professional control system validation.
117    """
118
119    def __init__(self, config: HILConfig):
120        """Initialize enhanced HIL system."""
121        self._config = config
122        self._state = HILState.IDLE
123        self._logger = logging.getLogger(f"hil_{config.system_id}")
124
125        # Core components
126        self._device_manager = DeviceManager()
127        self._communication_interfaces: Dict[str, CommunicationProtocol] = {}
128        self._simulation_bridge: Optional['SimulationBridge'] = None  # noqa: F821
129
130        # Real-time components
131        self._real_time_scheduler: Optional['RealTimeScheduler'] = None  # noqa: F821
132        self._timing_monitor = TimingMonitor(config.timing)
133
134        # Testing and validation
135        self._fault_injector: Optional['FaultInjector'] = None  # noqa: F821
136        self._test_framework: Optional['HILTestFramework'] = None  # noqa: F821
137        self._data_logger: Optional['HILDataLogger'] = None  # noqa: F821
138
139        # Execution control
140        self._main_task: Optional[asyncio.Task] = None
141        self._stop_event = asyncio.Event()
142        self._emergency_stop = False
143
144        # Data exchange
145        self._input_data: Dict[str, Any] = {}
146        self._output_data: Dict[str, Any] = {}
147        self._simulation_data: Dict[str, Any] = {}
148
149        # Performance monitoring
150        self._performance_metrics = HILPerformanceMetrics()
151        self._safety_monitor = SafetyMonitor(config)
152
153    @property
154    def state(self) -> HILState:
155        """Get current HIL system state."""
156        return self._state
157
158    @property
159    def config(self) -> HILConfig:
160        """Get HIL configuration."""
161        return self._config
162
163    @property
164    def performance_metrics(self) -> 'HILPerformanceMetrics':
165        """Get performance metrics."""
166        return self._performance_metrics
167
168    async def initialize(self) -> bool:
169        """Initialize HIL system components."""
170        try:
171            self._state = HILState.INITIALIZING
172            self._logger.info(f"Initializing HIL system {self._config.system_id}")
173
174            # Initialize communication interfaces
175            await self._setup_communication()
176
177            # Initialize hardware devices
178            await self._setup_hardware()
179
180            # Initialize simulation bridge if needed
181            if self._config.mode in [HILMode.SIMULATION_ONLY, HILMode.HYBRID]:
182                await self._setup_simulation()
183
184            # Initialize real-time scheduler
185            if self._config.real_time:
186                await self._setup_real_time()
187
188            # Initialize fault injection
189            await self._setup_fault_injection()
190
191            # Initialize test framework
192            if self._config.enable_automated_testing:
193                await self._setup_test_framework()
194
195            # Initialize data logging
196            if self._config.enable_logging:
197                await self._setup_data_logging()
198
199            # Perform system self-test
200            if not await self._system_self_test():
201                raise Exception("System self-test failed")
202
203            self._state = HILState.READY
204            self._logger.info("HIL system initialization completed successfully")
205            return True
206
207        except Exception as e:
208            self._logger.error(f"HIL system initialization failed: {e}")
209            self._state = HILState.ERROR
210            return False
211
212    async def start(self) -> bool:
213        """Start HIL system operation."""
214        try:
215            if self._state != HILState.READY:
216                raise Exception(f"Cannot start HIL system in state {self._state}")
217
218            self._logger.info("Starting HIL system operation")
219            self._state = HILState.RUNNING
220            self._stop_event.clear()
221
222            # Start main execution loop
223            self._main_task = asyncio.create_task(self._main_loop())
224
225            # Start subsystems
226            if self._real_time_scheduler:
227                await self._real_time_scheduler.start()
228
229            if self._data_logger:
230                await self._data_logger.start()
231
232            self._logger.info("HIL system started successfully")
233            return True
234
235        except Exception as e:
236            self._logger.error(f"Failed to start HIL system: {e}")
237            self._state = HILState.ERROR
238            return False
239
240    async def stop(self) -> bool:
241        """Stop HIL system operation."""
242        try:
243            self._logger.info("Stopping HIL system")
244            self._stop_event.set()
245
246            # Stop main loop
247            if self._main_task:
248                self._main_task.cancel()
249                try:
250                    await self._main_task
251                except asyncio.CancelledError:
252                    pass
253
254            # Stop subsystems
255            if self._real_time_scheduler:
256                await self._real_time_scheduler.stop()
257
258            if self._data_logger:
259                await self._data_logger.stop()
260
261            # Stop hardware devices
262            await self._device_manager.stop_all()
263
264            self._state = HILState.IDLE
265            self._logger.info("HIL system stopped")
266            return True
267
268        except Exception as e:
269            self._logger.error(f"Error stopping HIL system: {e}")
270            return False
271
272    async def emergency_stop(self) -> bool:
273        """Perform emergency stop of HIL system."""
274        try:
275            self._logger.warning("Emergency stop triggered!")
276            self._emergency_stop = True
277            self._stop_event.set()
278
279            # Immediately stop all actuators
280            for device_id in self._device_manager.list_devices():
281                device = self._device_manager.get_device(device_id)
282                if hasattr(device, 'emergency_stop'):
283                    await device.emergency_stop()
284
285            self._state = HILState.ERROR
286            return True
287
288        except Exception as e:
289            self._logger.error(f"Emergency stop failed: {e}")
290            return False
291
292    async def pause(self) -> bool:
293        """Pause HIL system operation."""
294        if self._state == HILState.RUNNING:
295            self._state = HILState.PAUSED
296            self._logger.info("HIL system paused")
297            return True
298        return False
299
300    async def resume(self) -> bool:
301        """Resume HIL system operation."""
302        if self._state == HILState.PAUSED:
303            self._state = HILState.RUNNING
304            self._logger.info("HIL system resumed")
305            return True
306        return False
307
308    async def run_test_scenario(self, scenario: TestScenario) -> Dict[str, Any]:
309        """Run specific test scenario."""
310        try:
311            self._logger.info(f"Running test scenario: {scenario.name}")
312
313            # Set initial conditions
314            await self._apply_initial_conditions(scenario.initial_conditions)
315
316            # Configure parameters
317            await self._apply_parameters(scenario.parameters)
318
319            # Configure fault scenarios
320            if scenario.fault_scenarios and self._fault_injector:
321                for fault_scenario in scenario.fault_scenarios:
322                    await self._fault_injector.configure_scenario(fault_scenario)
323
324            # Run scenario
325            start_time = time.time()
326            scenario_data = []
327
328            while (time.time() - start_time) < scenario.duration:
329                # Collect data
330                current_data = {
331                    'timestamp': time.time() - start_time,
332                    'inputs': self._input_data.copy(),
333                    'outputs': self._output_data.copy(),
334                    'simulation': self._simulation_data.copy()
335                }
336                scenario_data.append(current_data)
337
338                await asyncio.sleep(self._config.timing.sample_time)
339
340            # Analyze results
341            results = await self._analyze_scenario_results(scenario, scenario_data)
342
343            self._logger.info(f"Test scenario {scenario.name} completed")
344            return results
345
346        except Exception as e:
347            self._logger.error(f"Test scenario {scenario.name} failed: {e}")
348            return {'status': 'failed', 'error': str(e)}
349
350    async def get_system_status(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
351        """Get comprehensive system status."""
352        device_status = self._device_manager.get_status_summary()
353
354        status = {
355            'system_id': self._config.system_id,
356            'state': self._state.value,
357            'mode': self._config.mode.value,
358            'real_time': self._config.real_time,
359            'emergency_stop': self._emergency_stop,
360            'devices': device_status,
361            'performance': self._performance_metrics.get_summary(),
362            'timing': self._timing_monitor.get_statistics(),
363            'safety': self._safety_monitor.get_status(),
364            'uptime': time.time() - getattr(self, '_start_time', time.time())
365        }
366
367        return status
368
369    async def _setup_communication(self) -> None:
370        """Setup communication interfaces."""
371        try:
372            # Create controller interface
373            controller_interface = NetworkInterfaceFactory.create_interface(
374                f"{self._config.protocol}_client",
375                name="hil_controller",
376                config_overrides={'endpoint': self._config.controller_endpoint}
377            )
378
379            # Create plant interface
380            plant_interface = NetworkInterfaceFactory.create_interface(
381                f"{self._config.protocol}_server",
382                name="hil_plant",
383                config_overrides={'endpoint': self._config.plant_endpoint}
384            )
385
386            self._communication_interfaces['controller'] = controller_interface
387            self._communication_interfaces['plant'] = plant_interface
388
389            # Connect interfaces
390            await controller_interface.connect({})
391            await plant_interface.connect({'server_mode': True})
392
393        except Exception as e:
394            raise Exception(f"Failed to setup communication: {e}")
395
396    async def _setup_hardware(self) -> None:
397        """Setup hardware devices."""
398        try:
399            from ..hardware.factory import HardwareInterfaceFactory
400
401            for device_config in self._config.hardware_devices:
402                device_type = device_config['type']
403                device_id = device_config['id']
404                config = device_config.get('config', {})
405
406                device = HardwareInterfaceFactory.create_device(
407                    device_type, device_id, config
408                )
409
410                self._device_manager.add_device(device)
411
412            # Initialize all devices
413            await self._device_manager.start_all()
414
415        except Exception as e:
416            raise Exception(f"Failed to setup hardware: {e}")
417
418    async def _setup_simulation(self) -> None:
419        """Setup simulation bridge."""
420        try:
421            from .simulation_bridge import SimulationBridge
422
423            self._simulation_bridge = SimulationBridge(
424                model_name=self._config.simulation_model,
425                parameters=self._config.simulation_params
426            )
427
428            await self._simulation_bridge.initialize()
429
430        except Exception as e:
431            raise Exception(f"Failed to setup simulation: {e}")
432
433    async def _setup_real_time(self) -> None:
434        """Setup real-time scheduler."""
435        try:
436            from .real_time_sync import RealTimeScheduler
437
438            self._real_time_scheduler = RealTimeScheduler(
439                sample_time=self._config.timing.sample_time,
440                priority=self._config.timing.priority,
441                cpu_affinity=self._config.timing.cpu_affinity
442            )
443
444        except Exception as e:
445            raise Exception(f"Failed to setup real-time scheduler: {e}")
446
447    async def _setup_fault_injection(self) -> None:
448        """Setup fault injection system."""
449        try:
450            from .fault_injection import FaultInjector
451
452            self._fault_injector = FaultInjector(
453                device_manager=self._device_manager,
454                communication_interfaces=self._communication_interfaces
455            )
456
457        except Exception as e:
458            raise Exception(f"Failed to setup fault injection: {e}")
459
460    async def _setup_test_framework(self) -> None:
461        """Setup automated test framework."""
462        try:
463            from .test_automation import HILTestFramework
464
465            self._test_framework = HILTestFramework(
466                hil_system=self,
467                test_scenarios=self._config.test_scenarios
468            )
469
470        except Exception as e:
471            raise Exception(f"Failed to setup test framework: {e}")
472
473    async def _setup_data_logging(self) -> None:
474        """Setup data logging system."""
475        try:
476            from .data_logging import HILDataLogger, LoggingConfig
477
478            logging_config = LoggingConfig(
479                buffer_size=self._config.data_buffer_size,
480                sample_rate=1.0 / self._config.timing.sample_time
481            )
482
483            self._data_logger = HILDataLogger(logging_config)
484            await self._data_logger.initialize()
485
486        except Exception as e:
487            raise Exception(f"Failed to setup data logging: {e}")
488
489    async def _system_self_test(self) -> bool:
490        """Perform comprehensive system self-test."""
491        try:
492            self._logger.info("Performing system self-test")
493
494            # Test communication interfaces
495            for name, interface in self._communication_interfaces.items():
496                if not hasattr(interface, 'get_connection_state'):
497                    continue
498                # Basic connectivity test would go here
499
500            # Test hardware devices
501            health_results = await self._device_manager.health_check_all()
502            for device_id, result in health_results.items():
503                if result.get('overall_status') != 'PASS':
504                    self._logger.warning(f"Device {device_id} health check failed")
505
506            # Test simulation bridge
507            if self._simulation_bridge:
508                if not await self._simulation_bridge.self_test():
509                    return False
510
511            self._logger.info("System self-test completed successfully")
512            return True
513
514        except Exception as e:
515            self._logger.error(f"System self-test failed: {e}")
516            return False
517
518    async def _main_loop(self) -> None:
519        """Main HIL execution loop."""
520        try:
521            loop_start_time = time.time()
522            iteration = 0
523
524            while not self._stop_event.is_set() and self._state == HILState.RUNNING:
525                iteration_start = time.time()
526
527                # Read inputs from hardware/communication
528                await self._read_inputs()
529
530                # Update simulation if enabled
531                if self._simulation_bridge:
532                    await self._update_simulation()
533
534                # Process safety monitoring
535                await self._safety_monitor.check_safety(self._input_data, self._output_data)
536
537                # Write outputs to hardware/communication
538                await self._write_outputs()
539
540                # Log data
541                if self._data_logger:
542                    await self._data_logger.log_data({
543                        'iteration': iteration,
544                        'timestamp': time.time() - loop_start_time,
545                        'inputs': self._input_data.copy(),
546                        'outputs': self._output_data.copy(),
547                        'simulation': self._simulation_data.copy()
548                    })
549
550                # Update performance metrics
551                iteration_time = time.time() - iteration_start
552                self._performance_metrics.update(iteration_time)
553                self._timing_monitor.record_iteration(iteration_time)
554
555                # Real-time scheduling
556                if self._real_time_scheduler:
557                    await self._real_time_scheduler.wait_for_next_period()
558                else:
559                    # Simple timing control
560                    elapsed = time.time() - iteration_start
561                    sleep_time = max(0, self._config.timing.sample_time - elapsed)
562                    if sleep_time > 0:
563                        await asyncio.sleep(sleep_time)
564
565                iteration += 1
566
567        except Exception as e:
568            self._logger.error(f"Main loop error: {e}")
569            self._state = HILState.ERROR
570
571    async def _read_inputs(self) -> None:
572        """Read inputs from all sources."""
573        # Read from hardware devices
574        for device_id in self._device_manager.list_devices():
575            device = self._device_manager.get_device(device_id)
576            try:
577                data = await device.read_data()
578                self._input_data.update({f"{device_id}_{k}": v for k, v in data.items()})
579            except Exception as e:
580                self._logger.warning(f"Error reading from device {device_id}: {e}")
581
582        # Read from communication interfaces
583        for name, interface in self._communication_interfaces.items():
584            try:
585                # Interface-specific data reading would be implemented here
586                pass
587            except Exception as e:
588                self._logger.warning(f"Error reading from interface {name}: {e}")
589
590    async def _update_simulation(self) -> None:
591        """Update simulation model."""
592        if self._simulation_bridge:
593            try:
594                self._simulation_data = await self._simulation_bridge.step(
595                    self._input_data, self._config.timing.sample_time
596                )
597            except Exception as e:
598                self._logger.warning(f"Simulation update error: {e}")
599
600    async def _write_outputs(self) -> None:
601        """Write outputs to all destinations."""
602        # Write to hardware devices
603        for device_id in self._device_manager.list_devices():
604            device = self._device_manager.get_device(device_id)
605            try:
606                # Extract relevant data for this device
607                device_data = {
608                    k.replace(f"{device_id}_", ""): v
609                    for k, v in self._output_data.items()
610                    if k.startswith(f"{device_id}_")
611                }
612                if device_data:
613                    await device.write_data(device_data)
614            except Exception as e:
615                self._logger.warning(f"Error writing to device {device_id}: {e}")
616
617    async def _apply_initial_conditions(self, conditions: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
618        """Apply initial conditions for test scenario."""
619        for key, value in conditions.items():
620            self._output_data[key] = value
621
622    async def _apply_parameters(self, parameters: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
623        """Apply parameters for test scenario."""
624        if self._simulation_bridge:
625            await self._simulation_bridge.set_parameters(parameters)
626
627    async def _analyze_scenario_results(self, scenario: TestScenario, data: List[Dict[str, Any]]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
628        """Analyze test scenario results."""
629        # Basic result analysis - would be expanded for specific test requirements
630        results = {
631            'scenario_name': scenario.name,
632            'status': 'completed',
633            'duration': scenario.duration,
634            'data_points': len(data),
635            'passed': True,
636            'metrics': {}
637        }
638
639        # Check expected results against tolerance
640        for key, expected in scenario.expected_results.items():
641            scenario.tolerance.get(key, 0.01)
642            # Analysis logic would be implemented here based on requirements
643
644        return results
645
646
647class TimingMonitor:
648    """Monitor timing performance of HIL system."""
649
650    def __init__(self, timing_config: TimingConfig):
651        self.config = timing_config
652        self.iteration_times: List[float] = []
653        self.deadline_misses = 0
654        self.max_jitter = 0.0
655
656    def record_iteration(self, iteration_time: float) -> None:
657        """Record iteration timing."""
658        self.iteration_times.append(iteration_time)
659
660        # Keep only recent history
661        if len(self.iteration_times) > 1000:
662            self.iteration_times.pop(0)
663
664        # Check for deadline miss
665        deadline = self.config.sample_time * self.config.deadline_factor
666        if iteration_time > deadline:
667            self.deadline_misses += 1
668
669        # Update jitter
670        if len(self.iteration_times) > 1:
671            jitter = abs(iteration_time - self.iteration_times[-2])
672            self.max_jitter = max(self.max_jitter, jitter)
673
674    def get_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
675        """Get timing statistics."""
676        if not self.iteration_times:
677            return {}
678
679        return {
680            'mean_time': np.mean(self.iteration_times),
681            'max_time': np.max(self.iteration_times),
682            'min_time': np.min(self.iteration_times),
683            'std_time': np.std(self.iteration_times),
684            'deadline_misses': self.deadline_misses,
685            'max_jitter': self.max_jitter,
686            'deadline_miss_rate': self.deadline_misses / len(self.iteration_times)
687        }
688
689
690class HILPerformanceMetrics:
691    """Performance metrics for HIL system."""
692
693    def __init__(self):
694        self.iterations = 0
695        self.total_time = 0.0
696        self.cpu_usage = 0.0
697        self.memory_usage = 0.0
698
699    def update(self, iteration_time: float) -> None:
700        """Update performance metrics."""
701        self.iterations += 1
702        self.total_time += iteration_time
703
704    def get_summary(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
705        """Get performance summary."""
706        return {
707            'iterations': self.iterations,
708            'avg_iteration_time': self.total_time / max(1, self.iterations),
709            'cpu_usage': self.cpu_usage,
710            'memory_usage': self.memory_usage
711        }
712

722    async def check_safety(self, inputs: Dict[str, Any], outputs: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool:
723        """Check safety conditions."""
724        # Implement safety checks based on configuration
725        # This would include limits checking, rate limiting, etc.
726        self.last_check = time.time()
727        return True

730        """Get safety status."""

734            'status': 'safe' if self.safety_violations == 0 else 'warning'

EnhancedHILSystemÂ¶

Enhanced Hardware-in-the-Loop system with advanced capabilities.

This class provides a comprehensive HIL framework that integrates simulation, hardware, real-time scheduling, fault injection, and automated testing for professional control system validation.

Source CodeÂ¶

  1class EnhancedHILSystem:
  2    """
  3    Enhanced Hardware-in-the-Loop system with advanced capabilities.
  4
  5    This class provides a comprehensive HIL framework that integrates
  6    simulation, hardware, real-time scheduling, fault injection,
  7    and automated testing for professional control system validation.
  8    """
  9
 10    def __init__(self, config: HILConfig):
 11        """Initialize enhanced HIL system."""
 12        self._config = config
 13        self._state = HILState.IDLE
 14        self._logger = logging.getLogger(f"hil_{config.system_id}")
 15
 16        # Core components
 17        self._device_manager = DeviceManager()
 18        self._communication_interfaces: Dict[str, CommunicationProtocol] = {}
 19        self._simulation_bridge: Optional['SimulationBridge'] = None  # noqa: F821
 20
 21        # Real-time components
 22        self._real_time_scheduler: Optional['RealTimeScheduler'] = None  # noqa: F821
 23        self._timing_monitor = TimingMonitor(config.timing)
 24
 25        # Testing and validation
 26        self._fault_injector: Optional['FaultInjector'] = None  # noqa: F821
 27        self._test_framework: Optional['HILTestFramework'] = None  # noqa: F821
 28        self._data_logger: Optional['HILDataLogger'] = None  # noqa: F821
 29
 30        # Execution control
 31        self._main_task: Optional[asyncio.Task] = None
 32        self._stop_event = asyncio.Event()
 33        self._emergency_stop = False
 34
 35        # Data exchange
 36        self._input_data: Dict[str, Any] = {}
 37        self._output_data: Dict[str, Any] = {}
 38        self._simulation_data: Dict[str, Any] = {}
 39
 40        # Performance monitoring
 41        self._performance_metrics = HILPerformanceMetrics()
 42        self._safety_monitor = SafetyMonitor(config)
 43
 44    @property
 45    def state(self) -> HILState:
 46        """Get current HIL system state."""
 47        return self._state
 48
 49    @property
 50    def config(self) -> HILConfig:
 51        """Get HIL configuration."""
 52        return self._config
 53
 54    @property
 55    def performance_metrics(self) -> 'HILPerformanceMetrics':
 56        """Get performance metrics."""
 57        return self._performance_metrics
 58
 59    async def initialize(self) -> bool:
 60        """Initialize HIL system components."""
 61        try:
 62            self._state = HILState.INITIALIZING
 63            self._logger.info(f"Initializing HIL system {self._config.system_id}")
 64
 65            # Initialize communication interfaces
 66            await self._setup_communication()
 67
 68            # Initialize hardware devices
 69            await self._setup_hardware()
 70
 71            # Initialize simulation bridge if needed
 72            if self._config.mode in [HILMode.SIMULATION_ONLY, HILMode.HYBRID]:
 73                await self._setup_simulation()
 74
 75            # Initialize real-time scheduler
 76            if self._config.real_time:
 77                await self._setup_real_time()
 78
 79            # Initialize fault injection
 80            await self._setup_fault_injection()
 81
 82            # Initialize test framework
 83            if self._config.enable_automated_testing:
 84                await self._setup_test_framework()
 85
 86            # Initialize data logging
 87            if self._config.enable_logging:
 88                await self._setup_data_logging()
 89
 90            # Perform system self-test
 91            if not await self._system_self_test():
 92                raise Exception("System self-test failed")
 93
 94            self._state = HILState.READY
 95            self._logger.info("HIL system initialization completed successfully")
 96            return True
 97
 98        except Exception as e:
 99            self._logger.error(f"HIL system initialization failed: {e}")
100            self._state = HILState.ERROR
101            return False
102
103    async def start(self) -> bool:
104        """Start HIL system operation."""
105        try:
106            if self._state != HILState.READY:
107                raise Exception(f"Cannot start HIL system in state {self._state}")
108
109            self._logger.info("Starting HIL system operation")
110            self._state = HILState.RUNNING
111            self._stop_event.clear()
112
113            # Start main execution loop
114            self._main_task = asyncio.create_task(self._main_loop())
115
116            # Start subsystems
117            if self._real_time_scheduler:
118                await self._real_time_scheduler.start()
119
120            if self._data_logger:
121                await self._data_logger.start()
122
123            self._logger.info("HIL system started successfully")
124            return True
125
126        except Exception as e:
127            self._logger.error(f"Failed to start HIL system: {e}")
128            self._state = HILState.ERROR
129            return False
130
131    async def stop(self) -> bool:
132        """Stop HIL system operation."""
133        try:
134            self._logger.info("Stopping HIL system")
135            self._stop_event.set()
136
137            # Stop main loop
138            if self._main_task:
139                self._main_task.cancel()
140                try:
141                    await self._main_task
142                except asyncio.CancelledError:
143                    pass
144
145            # Stop subsystems
146            if self._real_time_scheduler:
147                await self._real_time_scheduler.stop()
148
149            if self._data_logger:
150                await self._data_logger.stop()
151
152            # Stop hardware devices
153            await self._device_manager.stop_all()
154
155            self._state = HILState.IDLE
156            self._logger.info("HIL system stopped")
157            return True
158
159        except Exception as e:
160            self._logger.error(f"Error stopping HIL system: {e}")
161            return False
162
163    async def emergency_stop(self) -> bool:
164        """Perform emergency stop of HIL system."""
165        try:
166            self._logger.warning("Emergency stop triggered!")
167            self._emergency_stop = True
168            self._stop_event.set()
169
170            # Immediately stop all actuators
171            for device_id in self._device_manager.list_devices():
172                device = self._device_manager.get_device(device_id)
173                if hasattr(device, 'emergency_stop'):
174                    await device.emergency_stop()
175
176            self._state = HILState.ERROR
177            return True
178
179        except Exception as e:
180            self._logger.error(f"Emergency stop failed: {e}")
181            return False
182
183    async def pause(self) -> bool:
184        """Pause HIL system operation."""
185        if self._state == HILState.RUNNING:
186            self._state = HILState.PAUSED
187            self._logger.info("HIL system paused")
188            return True
189        return False
190
191    async def resume(self) -> bool:
192        """Resume HIL system operation."""
193        if self._state == HILState.PAUSED:
194            self._state = HILState.RUNNING
195            self._logger.info("HIL system resumed")
196            return True
197        return False
198
199    async def run_test_scenario(self, scenario: TestScenario) -> Dict[str, Any]:
200        """Run specific test scenario."""
201        try:
202            self._logger.info(f"Running test scenario: {scenario.name}")
203
204            # Set initial conditions
205            await self._apply_initial_conditions(scenario.initial_conditions)
206
207            # Configure parameters
208            await self._apply_parameters(scenario.parameters)
209
210            # Configure fault scenarios
211            if scenario.fault_scenarios and self._fault_injector:
212                for fault_scenario in scenario.fault_scenarios:
213                    await self._fault_injector.configure_scenario(fault_scenario)
214
215            # Run scenario
216            start_time = time.time()
217            scenario_data = []
218
219            while (time.time() - start_time) < scenario.duration:
220                # Collect data
221                current_data = {
222                    'timestamp': time.time() - start_time,
223                    'inputs': self._input_data.copy(),
224                    'outputs': self._output_data.copy(),
225                    'simulation': self._simulation_data.copy()
226                }
227                scenario_data.append(current_data)
228
229                await asyncio.sleep(self._config.timing.sample_time)
230
231            # Analyze results
232            results = await self._analyze_scenario_results(scenario, scenario_data)
233
234            self._logger.info(f"Test scenario {scenario.name} completed")
235            return results
236
237        except Exception as e:
238            self._logger.error(f"Test scenario {scenario.name} failed: {e}")
239            return {'status': 'failed', 'error': str(e)}
240
241    async def get_system_status(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
242        """Get comprehensive system status."""
243        device_status = self._device_manager.get_status_summary()
244
245        status = {
246            'system_id': self._config.system_id,
247            'state': self._state.value,
248            'mode': self._config.mode.value,
249            'real_time': self._config.real_time,
250            'emergency_stop': self._emergency_stop,
251            'devices': device_status,
252            'performance': self._performance_metrics.get_summary(),
253            'timing': self._timing_monitor.get_statistics(),
254            'safety': self._safety_monitor.get_status(),
255            'uptime': time.time() - getattr(self, '_start_time', time.time())
256        }
257
258        return status
259
260    async def _setup_communication(self) -> None:
261        """Setup communication interfaces."""
262        try:
263            # Create controller interface
264            controller_interface = NetworkInterfaceFactory.create_interface(
265                f"{self._config.protocol}_client",
266                name="hil_controller",
267                config_overrides={'endpoint': self._config.controller_endpoint}
268            )
269
270            # Create plant interface
271            plant_interface = NetworkInterfaceFactory.create_interface(
272                f"{self._config.protocol}_server",
273                name="hil_plant",
274                config_overrides={'endpoint': self._config.plant_endpoint}
275            )
276
277            self._communication_interfaces['controller'] = controller_interface
278            self._communication_interfaces['plant'] = plant_interface
279
280            # Connect interfaces
281            await controller_interface.connect({})
282            await plant_interface.connect({'server_mode': True})
283
284        except Exception as e:
285            raise Exception(f"Failed to setup communication: {e}")
286
287    async def _setup_hardware(self) -> None:
288        """Setup hardware devices."""
289        try:
290            from ..hardware.factory import HardwareInterfaceFactory
291
292            for device_config in self._config.hardware_devices:
293                device_type = device_config['type']
294                device_id = device_config['id']
295                config = device_config.get('config', {})
296
297                device = HardwareInterfaceFactory.create_device(
298                    device_type, device_id, config
299                )
300
301                self._device_manager.add_device(device)
302
303            # Initialize all devices
304            await self._device_manager.start_all()
305
306        except Exception as e:
307            raise Exception(f"Failed to setup hardware: {e}")
308
309    async def _setup_simulation(self) -> None:
310        """Setup simulation bridge."""
311        try:
312            from .simulation_bridge import SimulationBridge
313
314            self._simulation_bridge = SimulationBridge(
315                model_name=self._config.simulation_model,
316                parameters=self._config.simulation_params
317            )
318
319            await self._simulation_bridge.initialize()
320
321        except Exception as e:
322            raise Exception(f"Failed to setup simulation: {e}")
323
324    async def _setup_real_time(self) -> None:
325        """Setup real-time scheduler."""
326        try:
327            from .real_time_sync import RealTimeScheduler
328
329            self._real_time_scheduler = RealTimeScheduler(
330                sample_time=self._config.timing.sample_time,
331                priority=self._config.timing.priority,
332                cpu_affinity=self._config.timing.cpu_affinity
333            )
334
335        except Exception as e:
336            raise Exception(f"Failed to setup real-time scheduler: {e}")
337
338    async def _setup_fault_injection(self) -> None:
339        """Setup fault injection system."""
340        try:
341            from .fault_injection import FaultInjector
342
343            self._fault_injector = FaultInjector(
344                device_manager=self._device_manager,
345                communication_interfaces=self._communication_interfaces
346            )
347
348        except Exception as e:
349            raise Exception(f"Failed to setup fault injection: {e}")
350
351    async def _setup_test_framework(self) -> None:
352        """Setup automated test framework."""
353        try:
354            from .test_automation import HILTestFramework
355
356            self._test_framework = HILTestFramework(
357                hil_system=self,
358                test_scenarios=self._config.test_scenarios
359            )
360
361        except Exception as e:
362            raise Exception(f"Failed to setup test framework: {e}")
363
364    async def _setup_data_logging(self) -> None:
365        """Setup data logging system."""
366        try:
367            from .data_logging import HILDataLogger, LoggingConfig
368
369            logging_config = LoggingConfig(
370                buffer_size=self._config.data_buffer_size,
371                sample_rate=1.0 / self._config.timing.sample_time
372            )
373
374            self._data_logger = HILDataLogger(logging_config)
375            await self._data_logger.initialize()
376
377        except Exception as e:
378            raise Exception(f"Failed to setup data logging: {e}")
379
380    async def _system_self_test(self) -> bool:
381        """Perform comprehensive system self-test."""
382        try:
383            self._logger.info("Performing system self-test")
384
385            # Test communication interfaces
386            for name, interface in self._communication_interfaces.items():
387                if not hasattr(interface, 'get_connection_state'):
388                    continue
389                # Basic connectivity test would go here
390
391            # Test hardware devices
392            health_results = await self._device_manager.health_check_all()
393            for device_id, result in health_results.items():
394                if result.get('overall_status') != 'PASS':
395                    self._logger.warning(f"Device {device_id} health check failed")
396
397            # Test simulation bridge
398            if self._simulation_bridge:
399                if not await self._simulation_bridge.self_test():
400                    return False
401
402            self._logger.info("System self-test completed successfully")
403            return True
404
405        except Exception as e:
406            self._logger.error(f"System self-test failed: {e}")
407            return False
408
409    async def _main_loop(self) -> None:
410        """Main HIL execution loop."""
411        try:
412            loop_start_time = time.time()
413            iteration = 0
414
415            while not self._stop_event.is_set() and self._state == HILState.RUNNING:
416                iteration_start = time.time()
417
418                # Read inputs from hardware/communication
419                await self._read_inputs()
420
421                # Update simulation if enabled
422                if self._simulation_bridge:
423                    await self._update_simulation()
424
425                # Process safety monitoring
426                await self._safety_monitor.check_safety(self._input_data, self._output_data)
427
428                # Write outputs to hardware/communication
429                await self._write_outputs()
430
431                # Log data
432                if self._data_logger:
433                    await self._data_logger.log_data({
434                        'iteration': iteration,
435                        'timestamp': time.time() - loop_start_time,
436                        'inputs': self._input_data.copy(),
437                        'outputs': self._output_data.copy(),
438                        'simulation': self._simulation_data.copy()
439                    })
440
441                # Update performance metrics
442                iteration_time = time.time() - iteration_start
443                self._performance_metrics.update(iteration_time)
444                self._timing_monitor.record_iteration(iteration_time)
445
446                # Real-time scheduling
447                if self._real_time_scheduler:
448                    await self._real_time_scheduler.wait_for_next_period()
449                else:
450                    # Simple timing control
451                    elapsed = time.time() - iteration_start
452                    sleep_time = max(0, self._config.timing.sample_time - elapsed)
453                    if sleep_time > 0:
454                        await asyncio.sleep(sleep_time)
455
456                iteration += 1
457
458        except Exception as e:
459            self._logger.error(f"Main loop error: {e}")
460            self._state = HILState.ERROR
461
462    async def _read_inputs(self) -> None:
463        """Read inputs from all sources."""
464        # Read from hardware devices
465        for device_id in self._device_manager.list_devices():
466            device = self._device_manager.get_device(device_id)
467            try:
468                data = await device.read_data()
469                self._input_data.update({f"{device_id}_{k}": v for k, v in data.items()})
470            except Exception as e:
471                self._logger.warning(f"Error reading from device {device_id}: {e}")
472
473        # Read from communication interfaces
474        for name, interface in self._communication_interfaces.items():
475            try:
476                # Interface-specific data reading would be implemented here
477                pass
478            except Exception as e:
479                self._logger.warning(f"Error reading from interface {name}: {e}")
480
481    async def _update_simulation(self) -> None:
482        """Update simulation model."""
483        if self._simulation_bridge:
484            try:
485                self._simulation_data = await self._simulation_bridge.step(
486                    self._input_data, self._config.timing.sample_time
487                )
488            except Exception as e:
489                self._logger.warning(f"Simulation update error: {e}")
490
491    async def _write_outputs(self) -> None:
492        """Write outputs to all destinations."""
493        # Write to hardware devices
494        for device_id in self._device_manager.list_devices():
495            device = self._device_manager.get_device(device_id)
496            try:
497                # Extract relevant data for this device
498                device_data = {
499                    k.replace(f"{device_id}_", ""): v
500                    for k, v in self._output_data.items()
501                    if k.startswith(f"{device_id}_")
502                }
503                if device_data:
504                    await device.write_data(device_data)
505            except Exception as e:
506                self._logger.warning(f"Error writing to device {device_id}: {e}")
507
508    async def _apply_initial_conditions(self, conditions: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
509        """Apply initial conditions for test scenario."""
510        for key, value in conditions.items():
511            self._output_data[key] = value
512
513    async def _apply_parameters(self, parameters: Dict[str, Any]) -> None:
514        """Apply parameters for test scenario."""
515        if self._simulation_bridge:
516            await self._simulation_bridge.set_parameters(parameters)
517
518    async def _analyze_scenario_results(self, scenario: TestScenario, data: List[Dict[str, Any]]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
519        """Analyze test scenario results."""
520        # Basic result analysis - would be expanded for specific test requirements
521        results = {
522            'scenario_name': scenario.name,
523            'status': 'completed',
524            'duration': scenario.duration,
525            'data_points': len(data),
526            'passed': True,
527            'metrics': {}
528        }
529
530        # Check expected results against tolerance
531        for key, expected in scenario.expected_results.items():
532            scenario.tolerance.get(key, 0.01)
533            # Analysis logic would be implemented here based on requirements
534
535        return results

TimingMonitorÂ¶

Monitor timing performance of HIL system.

Source CodeÂ¶

 1class TimingMonitor:
 2    """Monitor timing performance of HIL system."""
 3
 4    def __init__(self, timing_config: TimingConfig):
 5        self.config = timing_config
 6        self.iteration_times: List[float] = []
 7        self.deadline_misses = 0
 8        self.max_jitter = 0.0
 9
10    def record_iteration(self, iteration_time: float) -> None:
11        """Record iteration timing."""
12        self.iteration_times.append(iteration_time)
13
14        # Keep only recent history
15        if len(self.iteration_times) > 1000:
16            self.iteration_times.pop(0)
17
18        # Check for deadline miss
19        deadline = self.config.sample_time * self.config.deadline_factor
20        if iteration_time > deadline:
21            self.deadline_misses += 1
22
23        # Update jitter
24        if len(self.iteration_times) > 1:
25            jitter = abs(iteration_time - self.iteration_times[-2])
26            self.max_jitter = max(self.max_jitter, jitter)
27
28    def get_statistics(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
29        """Get timing statistics."""
30        if not self.iteration_times:
31            return {}
32
33        return {
34            'mean_time': np.mean(self.iteration_times),
35            'max_time': np.max(self.iteration_times),
36            'min_time': np.min(self.iteration_times),
37            'std_time': np.std(self.iteration_times),
38            'deadline_misses': self.deadline_misses,
39            'max_jitter': self.max_jitter,
40            'deadline_miss_rate': self.deadline_misses / len(self.iteration_times)
41        }

HILPerformanceMetricsÂ¶

Performance metrics for HIL system.

Source CodeÂ¶

 1class HILPerformanceMetrics:
 2    """Performance metrics for HIL system."""
 3
 4    def __init__(self):
 5        self.iterations = 0
 6        self.total_time = 0.0
 7        self.cpu_usage = 0.0
 8        self.memory_usage = 0.0
 9
10    def update(self, iteration_time: float) -> None:
11        """Update performance metrics."""
12        self.iterations += 1
13        self.total_time += iteration_time
14
15    def get_summary(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
16        """Get performance summary."""
17        return {
18            'iterations': self.iterations,
19            'avg_iteration_time': self.total_time / max(1, self.iterations),
20            'cpu_usage': self.cpu_usage,
21            'memory_usage': self.memory_usage
22        }

 1class SafetyMonitor:
 2    """Safety monitoring for HIL system."""

 5        self.config = config
 6        self.safety_violations = 0
 7        self.last_check = time.time()
 8
 9    async def check_safety(self, inputs: Dict[str, Any], outputs: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool:
10        """Check safety conditions."""
11        # Implement safety checks based on configuration
12        # This would include limits checking, rate limiting, etc.
13        self.last_check = time.time()
14        return True
15
16    def get_status(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
17        """Get safety status."""
18        return {
19            'violations': self.safety_violations,
20            'last_check': self.last_check,
21            'status': 'safe' if self.safety_violations == 0 else 'warning'
22        }
